text: The was a denomination of Japanese yen issued from 1946 to 1994 in paper form. Crudely made notes were first made in an unsuccessful attempt to curb inflation at the time, and the series as a whole is broken down into three different types of note. Only the last two have a known design which feature Iwakura Tomomi on the obverse, and Mount Fuji on the reverse. Starting in 1982, new 500 yen coins began to be minted which eventually replaced their paper counterparts. While the production of 500 yen notes continued until 1984, all of the notes issued were officially withdrawn from circulation in 1994. Five hundred yen notes were allowed to retain their legal tender status, but they are now worth more on the collector's market than at face value. ==Series== The first series of 500 yen notes (called "series A") were released in 1946 to control inflation which had been caused by the aftermath of World War II. These crudely made notes were short lived as they were withdrawn from circulation shortly after being issued due to widespread counterfeiting. The effort to lower inflation had also been a failure as it did not drop as expected. Starting on April 2, 1951 "series B" notes began to be issued with improved security features such as Watermarks. This time these new notes appeared to have been more successful, as they were issued for almost 20 years until finally being withdrawn on January 4, 1971. The final 500 yen notes are referred to as "series C" notes, and were issued starting on November 1, 1969 with new watermarks to enhance security. The issue came to an end on April 1, 1994 when 500 yen notes were withdrawn from circulation. ==Gallery== File:Series B 500 Yen Bank of Japan note - front.jpg|500 Yen "B series" note (front) Issued 1951 to 1971 File:Series B 500 Yen Bank of Japan note - back.jpg|Back of the "B series" note File:Series B 500 Yen Bank of Japan note - Watermark.jpg|Close-up of the watermark security feature used on the "B series" File:Series C 500 Yen Bank of Japan note - front.jpg|500 Yen "C series" note (front) Issued 1969 to 1994 File:Series C 500 Yen Bank of Japan note - back.jpg|Back of the "C series" note File:Series C 500 Yen Bank of Japan note - Watermark.jpg|Close-up of the watermark security feature used on the "C series" File:Japanese500yenSeriesB-crop.jpg|Close-up of Iwakura Tomomi on the obverse of the "C series" ==See also== *Banknotes of the Japanese yen *500 euro note *Hong Kong five hundred-dollar note *Indian 500-rupee note *Large denominations of United States currency *Philippine five hundred peso note ==References== Category:Banknotes of Japan Category:Japanese yen Category:Five-hundred-base-unit banknotes
